comments.html: If you happen to run bare metal kubernetes/openshift with e.g. Calico or Cilium CNI, running BGP between server and ToR almost becomes the default deployment. Obviously, now we're not in enterprise IT virtualisation territory anymore (although kubevirt could functionally provide most of the desired technology...)
comments.name: Albert Siersema

comments.html:
The answer is BGP + BFD. This project adds FRR on each server and then advertise all host and potentially also client VM IPs as /32 routes to the leafs. No M-LAG, VLANs does not span over multiple racks. There are some caveats since does not yet support accelerated datapath like DPDK. Maybe someone will add ES-IS to FRR in the near future...
